name: Sheraton City Center St. Louis

reviews.text: I can't beleive they charge you for parking, Internet, and business center after paying almost 190.00 a night. I would never stay here again!! Courtyard and Hampton are just ad nice with a lower rate free breakfast, Internet and PARKING.
reviews.title: No Extras!!

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights, November 18-20. Reserved one room with Hotwire at the nightly rate of $59 USD. I wanted this hotel since it was close to the Scottrade Center and was happy that I got it.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: We arrived at the Lambert-St. Louis airport and took the MetroLink ($3.75 from the airport, compared to $2 from anywhere else) to the Civic Center station, located a half hour away and directly across from the hotel. Anyone feeling unsafe riding public transit should sit in the most up-front car since that is where the train operator sits.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many reviewers have mentioned Brandon at the front desk, and it was he who checked in my friend and me. He was quite excited that we would come from Canada to visit St. Louis, and he was very efficient in making sure that we got a good room with two double beds.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Our room (609) was a very large suite with a view of South 14th Street and the MetroLink station. It had a living room area with a fold-out couch, a large work desk and a kitchen area with a sink, mini fridge and coffee maker. There were also two TVs, one in the living room and one across from the beds.
reviews.title: Not up to expectations

reviews.text: We stayed for a weekend at the Seraton. Let me just start by saying I booked through Hotwire. Beware if you want 2 queen beds, Hotwire books a king by default. When we checked in we asked for 2 beds. The front desk clerk said that the hotel was pretty full but she would check. I really wish I would have gotten her name because our room was fantastic! We ended up in a suite with the 2 queens. We ordered room service one morning, the staff there was amazing also. They removed the dirty dishes immediately from the front of our door. All of the staff was always helpful and freindly. The beds were SUPER comfortable. Our room was right by I-64 and we couldn't here much noise from the traffic. We did occasionally here noise other guests but it wasn't a big deal. There were other events going on that weekend so it was to be expected. I would stay at this hotel again. Especially if I'm going to and event at Scottrade Center. It's within very short walking distance. There were a few little things that irritated me. Like one of the beds had a blanket and the other didn't, the fire alarm going off on Friday night (its not like the hotel had control over this), and the parking garage can be a little frustrating. If you come back to the hotel later in the evening its not easy finding a spot. But the good outweighed the few minor irritations. All in all its a great hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable accomodations with friendly staff.

reviews.text: The service I received was excellent. The employees at the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly. Brandon made checking in easy and actually enjoyable. My room was clean, open, and comfortable. I was also able to arrange for a hotel shuttle to and from the office since I was traveling on business. I plan to stay here again in the future.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I'm a heavy business traveler that looks over 200 nights each year in hotels - most with Sheraton. I've stayed in the Sheraton City Center in St. Louis several times over the past few years and have had the same experience. I'm greeted by the most pleasant and customer service friendly staff around. In fact, big kudos to Staci S. Michele G. and Katrin B. for unknowingly salvaging my stay. They were just being their normal customer service friendly self. The facility on the other had is in need of a complete overhaul. The carpets are stained everywhere I go (elevators, hallways, inside my room, etc.). The furniture in the rooms date back to the early 80's (and I'm being nice here), The beds are concave. I had to sleep in the middle to find a comfortable spot that didn't make me feel like I'd roll out. My list goes on. I'd really like to recommend this Sheraton given its excellent staff and great location. However, I just can't bring myself to recommend that others face this monster of a facility.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff, Shoddy Facility!

reviews.text: Just recently stayed at this hotel for a family trip. It was a great location for going to the hockey game. The only sound we heard was not the highway which is right next door but the drums from a street band. Not sure how that works but not complaining.
reviews.title: Everything but the plates

reviews.text: The rooms themselves were very nice, the beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Much better than we could have hoped for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Sheraton on Dec22/23 to attend a sporting event. The location of the hotel was our prime reason for choosing this hotel - it is right across the street from the Scottrade Center. Our room was fine(nothing fancy) and suited our purposes. The staff was fine and everything was satisfactory until we checked out.
reviews.title: Problems with the valet? Not Sheraton's problem, evidently.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned in previous posts, parking is a nightmare. We valet parked upon arrival. The next morning, it was chaos at the valet stand. Hotel guest were hunting their own keys in the lockbox and helping out the valets with this task because they were so overwhelmed.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here!

reviews.text: We waited patiently for a while, but it soon became apparent that we were not going to get our car. Apparently no one could find our keys. First we were told that one of the valets was sick in the bathroom and he must have our keys in his pocket. He appeared and did not have our keys. Various valets were summoned - no keys. Then the search extended to the valet office, the security office, etc. No keys. The manager of the valet stand finally told us our keps were clearly gone, and he was trying to contact the valets who had worked the previous day to see if one of them had accidentally taken our keys home with him. (what?!) A search confirmed our car was in the lot - which lessened our concern that it might have been stolen. Still, no keys and none of the other valets who had worked the previous day were answering their phones.
reviews.title: Too bad the property isn't as good as the service.

reviews.text: This ordeal last for hours. It was just a few days before Christmas, very cold and we had few options. The valet manager did the best he could. He was young and seemed overwhelmed. We were told they could tow our car to a dealer, have another key made, etc but that would take a few days, Not an option for us. So we were left to our own devices. There really was nothing that the valet could do. While we waited for a family member to DRIVE THREE HOURS to bring us another set of keys, the valet manager paid for our lunch and a taxi for a quick trip to the local mall ( I had planned to stop by on our way out of town to pick up one last present for our daughter and HAD to get this done.)
reviews.title: great place to stay!

reviews.text: My complaint, besides the sloppiness of the valet stand, was that the folks at the front desk NEVER offered to put us back into our room, comp our room, apologize, etc. We were told that the valet service is subcontracted and not a part of the Sheraton. They were sympathetic but the thought of stepping up and offering something to make our day better (we were detained approx 6 hours in their lobby) never entered their minds.
reviews.title: Something for everyone at the Sheraton

reviews.text: Stayed 1 night during downtown COGIC Convocation....ALOT going on, but couldn't tell by staff prep & control. Across from rail, short walk from Scott Trade Center. Good Location. Short drive 2 White Castle (mmmm) Rooms were just OK! (TIP) Ask 4 room NOT facing inside atruim...trust me, it's nothing 2 look at! Parking garage is a "maze" & a lil' tricky, so be alert. Staff was excellent-ordered fresh towels and rcvd call 2 confirm delivery (bonus pts). If I needed 2 stay downtown, I'd stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: The staff at the Sheraton was top notch -- really A+ -- but they have a hard time making up for the rooms that are straight from 1980 -- cheap brass lamps, out of date fabrics, poor furniture design, and an outdated bathroom with no style at all. The designers have not figured out how to use the atrium (and the so-called "views" to the atrium") to improve the hotel exprerience, so the room end up with a motel feel -- and not a hotel feel. And the roof-top pool and terrace could have been beautiful -- but there was no decor, no "warmth", and way too much chlorine in the air to use the pool.
reviews.title: Great Staff -- but outdated rooms

reviews.text: I want to start by saying...hotel is gorgeous! The employees that work at the Sheraton made it even BETTER! They were extremely caring, generous & great! My children and I enjoyed our stay there and are definitely going to make another trip to St Louis and stay in that hotel. One special employee definitely made a difference in our stay, BRANDON! He stood out from all of the rest....very outgoing, friendly and caring...made us feel at home!!
reviews.title: Outstanding Employee!

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights on business using a Hotwire rate of $59.00 per night. It was such a bargain that I couldn't pass it up. The location was about six blocks walk to the other hotel that we were meeting at, but the price was worth it. Another good thing was that it is right across the street from the light rail system, which makes it a breeze to get to and from St. Louis (Lambert) airport (ticket cost $3.75). The hotel is a renovated warehouse. Only downside was that my room faced an empty interior courtyard, which made it difficult to judge weather/time of day with no natural sunlight. I could tolerate it for the price.
reviews.title: Right for the Price.

reviews.text: Not much to do around the hotel. Don't waste your time touring the area on foot, just hop quick cab ride to Laclede's Landing for lots of restaurant and nightlife choices.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a great location

aka: Sheraton City Center St. Louis Hotel Saint Louis
description: Sheraton St. Louis City Center Hotel & Suites is a beautifully appointed hotel in the heart of downtown.
